overview_of_class: This course is an intensive introduction to the scientific study of human personality and is organized around three broad questions: 1) How do people differ? 2) What are the processes and mechanisms underlying these personality differences? 3) What are the implications of these differences in people's lives? In addressing these questions, we will consider both classic and contemporary theoretical and empirical approaches to personality and focus on developing a dynamic understanding of human personality within its biological, social, and cultural contexts.
name: Psychology of Personality
title: WCAS PSYCH 215-0-20 Psychology of Personality

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is an intensive introduction to the scientific study of human personality and is organized around three broad questions: 1) How do people differ? 2) What are the processes and mechanisms underlying these personality differences? 3) What are the implications of these differences in people's lives? In addressing these questions, we will consider both classic and contemporary theoretical and empirical approaches to personality and focus on developing a dynamic understanding of human personality within its biological, social, and cultural contexts.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two in-class examinations (multiple choice and essay) and a few in-class quizzes.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Funder & Ozer (2007), PIECES OF THE PERSONALITY PUZZLE, ISBN-13: 9780393930351

McAdams, D. P. (2015). THE ART AND SCIENCE OF PERSONALITY DEVELOPMENT. New York: Guilford Press. ISBN 978-1-4625-1995-8.

class_attributes:
Social & Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory
subject: PSYCH
